Description: Assigned number of the brain tissue sample, from 1 to 33. 1-16 are habenula samples, and 17-33 are amygdala samples.
ID of the rat from which the tissue sample was taken. A single rat could have provided a sample for both amygdala and habenula experiments, or just one or the other.
Whether the dissection for that tissue sample was targeting the habenula or amygdala.
Whether the rat from which the tissue sample was taken self-administered fentanyl or saline solution.
Sex of the rat from which the tissue sample was taken.

Unique sample identifier, composed of: [Sample number]-[F for Fentanyl / S for Saline]-[Hb for Habenula / Amyg for Amygdala]-[Rat ID number]. Note that sample number doesn’t match Sample_Num in all cases.
Whether the rat had either 18 or 16 long-access sessions (6 hr) of fentanyl self-administration following the week of short-access sessions (2 hr) early in training.
Number of fentanyl self-administration sessions (16/18 6hrs sessions + 6 2hrs sessions).

The experimental batch in which sample RNA was extracted: habenula tissue samples were processed in one batch, and amygdala tissue samples in another batch. Exceptions to this were habenula tissue samples 10, 14 and 16, and amygdala tissue samples 29 and 33, which were processed for RNA extraction in a 3rd batch.

The batch in which the sample library was prepared: all habenula libraries were prepared together in one batch, and amygdala libraries in another batch, with the exception of 26, 30, and 33, which were run for library preparation in another batch because they needed to be re-run with more RNA.
The batch in which the sample library was sequenced: all habenula samples were run together in one batch and all amygdala samples were run together in another batch.
RNA concentration within each sample (in ng/uL).
Total amount of RNA in each sample (in µg).
RNA Integrity Number of each sample measured by LIBD researchers.
RNA Integrity Number of each sample returned by Psomagen lab.
RIN number from Psomagen, or from LIBD when the former wasn't available.
The total sum of read counts across all genes in each sample.
Total number of genes whose expression was detected (non-zero expressed) in each sample.
The decimal fraction of reads which mapped to the mitochondrial chromosome, of those which map at all for each sample.
The decimal fraction of reads assigned unambiguously to a gene, of those in total for each sample.
The decimal fraction of reads which successfully mapped to the reference genome for each sample.
The decimal fraction of reads which aligned concordantly to the reference genome for each sample.
Total overall drug intake of the rat across all long-access (6 hr) sessions, calculated based on 0.5 ug of drug delivery per infusion.
Total drug intake of the rat during the very last long-access (6 hr) session, calculated based on 0.5 ug of drug delivery per infusion.
The slope for the substance intake of the sample rat in the 1st hour of each session.
